pullRequest.body:
Add a new CI job which updates `nolints.json` and `style-exceptions.txt` periodically.

Cargo-culted from the mathlib 3 versions at
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/blob/master/scripts/update_nolints.sh (update script) and
https://github.com/leanprover-community/azure-scripts/blob/master/.github/workflows/nolints.yml (workflow).
Please review carefully!

[Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.239857.20update.20nolints.20periodically)

--------------
Open questions
- time interval: the mathlib3 version was once a day. That seems a bit excessive to me; I chose once a week for now (every Sunday).
- Are all the steps in the workflow necessary? (I cargo-culted them from `bors.yml`.) For instance, I can imagine the cleanup, uninstall pr-toolchain, print versions steps might not be necessary? (I don't *know* at all, though!) 
- Everything related to secrets and authentification is completely cargo-culted.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Thank you for the review. I have addressed all comments I could; for one, I need some help.
I suspect that if you merge master now, Action lint will get worried about missing quotes around a lot of the variable expansions.

> I suspect that if you merge master now, Action lint will get worried about missing quotes around a lot of the variable expansions.

Good point - actually, just about one variable \o/

I pushed the changes that I had suggested and the PR looks good to me!

I find that getting CI right is very hard: I would recommend merging and fixing issues along the way.

@grunweg, thanks for your patience here. Now that Bryan has made this new token, how about we try this out in production? :-)

bors d+

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for the reviews and help with the token. Let's test this!
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9175847785/job/25229746423)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9175847785/job/25229745944)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9175847785/job/25229746180)

I've added a personal token to mathlib4 with the `public_repo` permissions with the slightly more informative name `UPDATE_NOLINTS_TOKEN`; please commit the suggestions I've added first and then we can try merging.

I've added a personal token to mathlib4 with the `public_repo` permissions with the slightly more informative name `UPDATE_NOLINTS_TOKEN`; please commit the suggestions I've added first and then we can try merging.

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```
This file needs to be renamed so it is clearly labelled as part of CI. Humans shouldn't be running this locally to update the nolints!
Done, and left a big comment.

```suggestion

```
What is LCB_TOKEN? I'm guessing it is new, since it isn't otherwise mentioned in the repo. Could it have a more descriptive name?

As I wrote, I cargo-culted this from mathlib(3) --- so presumably, this is not needed.
Can you advise on the proper way to do this instead? I really don't know the CI setup well.
@eric-wieser do you know the answer here?
It stands for "Lean Community Bot", and comes from https://github.com/leanprover-community/azure-scripts/settings/secrets/actions

```suggestion
git push "$remote_name" HEAD:$branch_name
```
Maybe?
I don't know CI (nor YAML) too well - I'll happily accept your suggestion (feel free to do so yourself), but cannot evaluate it meaningfully.
Ok, this is just the variable set on line 10, so it is probably an oversight that the value is used explicitly here.
Is this needed, given the `lake exe cache get` step later?

```suggestion
gh_api repos/$owner_name/mathlib/issues/"$pr_id"/comments -X POST -d @- <<EOF
```
I suspect that this is what shellcheck is concerned about.

```suggestion
          echo "$HOME/.elan/bin" >> "$GITHUB_PATH"
```
maybe this as well?

```suggestion
          git remote add origin-bot "https://leanprover-community-bot:${{ secrets.UPDATE_NOLINTS_TOKEN }}@github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib.git"
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: update nolints periodically
